jobDescription: For Current Gilead Employees and Contractors:Please log onto your Internal Career Site to apply for this job.Job DescriptionSpecific Responsibilities:  Seeking a highly motivated, creative and collaborative individual with a strong passion for and dedication to discovery of new life-saving medicines. The candidate will join our internal efforts focused on the research and development of novel HIV therapeutics, including small molecule drugs and biologics, with a potential to achieve the ambitious goal of cure or remission of HIV infection. The successful candidate will collaborate with an experienced multidisciplinary team of scientists to explore and develop new tools, models and approaches, and using those for conducting key biological studies to advance team objectives in developing novel HIV cure therapeutics. Primary responsibilities will include: designing, performing and validating novel cell-based immunology assays for human and non-human primate studies, evaluating new targets and therapeutic approaches in a fast-paced team environment, interpreting results, proactively troubleshooting technical issues and recommending potential solutions based on experimental observations and/or literature reviews.  In addition the successful candidate would be expected to: Build strong internal scientific expertise, and introduce new techniques and models for the evaluation of therapeutic strategies targeting HIV replication and reservoirsConduct in-depth characterization of cellular and humoral immune responsesDevelop, execute and troubleshoot assays.Design, coordinate and execute key in vitro and in vivo proof-of-concept studies including in mouse and NHP modelsIdentify, evaluate, and support relevant external collaborationsParticipate in multidisciplinary team effortsPresent regular research updates to project teams and R&D; management Gilead is a fast-paced, data-driven, scientifically rigorous organization and the role will suit a scientist who is able to thrive in this type of environment.  Knowledge, Experience and Skills: PhD in immunology or relevant life science disciplineMinimum of 2 years post-doctoral experience focused on innovative research in immunology with proven achievements in industrial or academic settingsStrong level of understanding and expertise in viral immunology, and/or evaluation of immunotherapeutics including vaccinesExperience with a broad array of technologies to support assay development and discovery research is highly desired. Hands-on experience in cell culture and/or virology techniques such as primary cell isolation and culture, immune cell functional assays including ELISpot assays, multi-color FACS, ELISA/Luminex, as well as molecular biology techniques such as RNA/DNA isolation, qPCR and cloning. Experience in assay development, ability to evaluate quality of the data, recognize anomalous results and interpret experimental outcomes is essential. Excellent verbal communication and interpersonal skills. Communicate effectively within the Virology group and functional groups within Research.  #LI-KW1For jobs in the United States:As an equal opportunity employer, Gilead Sciences Inc. is committed to a diverse workforce.
